benchmark_details.name: NegBench
benchmark_details.overview: NegBench is a benchmark designed to evaluate negation understanding across various task variations and examples in image, video, and medical datasets. It consists of two core tasks: Retrieval with Negation and Multiple Choice Questions with Negated Captions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To systematically evaluate negation understanding in vision-language models (VLMs).

data.source: Various datasets adapted for the benchmark, including COCO, VOC2007, MSR-VTT, and CheXpert.
data.annotation: Generated captions using LLaMA for linguistic diversity and verified with object detectors.

methods: Evaluation on Retrieval and MCQ tasks
methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on retrieval success rates and accuracy of selected answers in MCQ tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher performance on these tasks indicates better understanding of negation by models.
